text: Eudonia xysmatias is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Edward Meyrick in 1907. This species is endemic to New Zealand. The wingspan is about 19 mm. The forewings are dark fuscous with yellowish-ferruginous scales and suffused with black. The first and second lines are represented by a straight series of whitish scales surrounded with yellowish-ferruginous suffusion. The hindwings are dark grey, sprinkled with blackish. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1907 Category:Scopariinae Category:Endemic fauna of New Zealand Category:Moths of New Zealand Category:Taxa named by Edward Meyrick
title: Eudonia xysmatias
